question:
With reference to the Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey finding a 10% prevalence of pre-diabetes among children, consider the following statements:
  1. Pre-diabetes is irreversible.
  2. Pre-diabetes increases the chances of getting type 1 diabetes in children.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Pre-diabetes is a reversible condition. It is a health condition characterised by high blood sugar levels but not high enough to be classified as diabetic. The study found that 10% of children in the age group of 5 to 9 are pre-diabetic. It also found a 10% prevalence in the 10-19 age group. Statement 2 is incorrect: Pre-diabetes increases the chances of acquiring type-2 diabetes. It also increases the chances of getting heard diseases and other serious health conditions like stroke. Type 2 diabetes is a life-long disease. It is the most common type of diabetes and it prevents the proper functioning of insulin.
